title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Getting Started

Install and Launching R packages
The code chunk below use p_load of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in te environment, it will luanch it into R if it has been installed.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
pacman::p_load(ggplot2)



Importing the data

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)



View Math Result using R hist

hist(exam_data$MATHS,
     main = "Histogram of Maths Exams Result",
     xlab = "Score",
     xlim = c(0, 100),
     ylab = "Count",
     ylim = c(0, 80),
     col = "lightblue",
     freq = TRUE)






View Math Result using ggplot

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 10, 
                 boundary = 100, 
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "lightblue") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Exams Result", 
       subtitle = "Maths",
       x = "Score",
       y = "Count")






View Math Result using ggplot2 dotplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth = 2.5, dotsize = 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL)






View Math Result using ggplot2 histogram

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "lightblue")






View Math Result by Gender using ggplot2 histogram

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "grey30") 






View Math Result using ggplot density

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()






View Math Result using ggplot boxplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()






View Math Result using ggplot notched boxplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)






View Math Result using ggplot boxplot and point

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter", size = 0.5)






View Math Result using ggplot violin plot


violin plot is a hybrid of a box plot and a kernel density plot shows peaks in the data. it can visualize the distribution of numerical data.
violin plot depict summary statistics and the density of each variable. (source: https://mode.com/blog/violin-plot-examples)



ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: ISSS608-VAA
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications
